business.headline: Sensex jumps 600 points: Why is stock market rising today?The S&P BSE Sensex rallied 561.67 points to 83,188.43, while the NSE Nifty50 added 186.60 points to 25,657.70 as of 2:56 points as of 2:56 PM.

How cash levels in mutual funds impact returns during volatile marketsIn the current market, volatility caused by global and external factors has led some mutual funds to increase their cash positions. The idea is to lower risk and protect portfolios from sudden corrections.

Can NPS help you save tax in the new regime? What salaried employees must knowFor salaried workers who have moved to the new tax regime, tax saving can feel limited. This has led many to question if there are still practical ways to ease their tax burden. Let's have a look.

Can your employer refuse gratuity if you get pension? Here's what employees must knowMany employees assume that receiving a pension from their employer means they may have to give up gratuity. But the law draws a clear distinction between the two. A recent court ruling has clarified what workers should know about their rights.

Why Mumbai remains India's top luxury housing hubThe global recognition Mumbai is receiving today is best understood as validation rather than arrival. International research now ranks the city among the world's fastest-growing luxury housing markets, reflecting sustained price appreciation at the very top end.

Using old tax regime? Here's how draft income tax rules 2026 could help you save moreIf you are still using the old income tax regime, the government's draft rules for 2026 may bring some welcome relief. Proposed changes to key exemptions and allowances could slightly lower your tax bill and make the traditional regime more rewarding.

RBI move hits Dalal Street stocks: BSE, Groww fall up to 10%. Here's whyThe selling pressure came after the RBI issued a revised circular on February 13 under its amended RBI (Commercial Banks – Credit Facilities) Directions. The new rules change how banks can lend to entities involved in the capital markets.

Sensex, Nifty open lower as market sentiment remain cautious over IT selloffThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 47.79 points to 82,578.97, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 7.45 points to 25,464.75 as of 9:48 am.

Man paid Rs 50,000 a year premium, insurance claim denied when mother fell illThe man said he had been paying around Rs 50,000 every year for his mother's policy and when she needed treatment, he went to the Lucknow office of Star Health and Allied Insurance, where he alleged he was made to wait for hours. His claim was denied.

Budget without populism and with capital outlays powers growth, jobs: PMDescribing the Budget for the fiscal year starting April 1 as reflective of his governance approach, PM Modi said the document is a good reflection of our governance style and priorities.

Have Rs 5,000? Here's why an emergency fund should come before your SIPYou've heard the advice, i.e., "Start a SIP immediately." But is that the smartest first move with Rs 5,000? The choice might surprise you.

Will AI change how you invest your money in stocks and mutual funds?The next market shift may not come from earnings or interest rates. It may come from AI. In this article, we explore how it could reshape your stock and mutual fund investments.

Air India fined Rs 1 crore for flying Airbus 8 times without airworthiness permitThe DGCA has imposed a fine of about Rs 1 crore on Air India for flying an Airbus aircraft eight times without a valid airworthiness permit. The aviation watchdog also said the lapse further eroded public trust in the airline.

Why personalised loans are becoming the go-to option in 2026The journey of hyper-personalisation in personal loans is going to get more exciting for customers with the increasing adoption of technology refining customer offerings, based on minute details of the customers.

RBI plans to update Kisan Credit Card rules : 5 key changes to trackThe Reserve Bank of India is preparing to overhaul the Kisan Credit Card scheme, and the proposed changes could reshape how farmers borrow and repay loans. With the new draft rules on the table, what exactly is set to change for farm credit?

Sensex crashes over 1,000 points: What's behind today's market bloodbath?The market opened on a weak note and remained under pressure throughout the session, with losses deepening in the second half. The decline appeared to be driven by profit booking at elevated levels and a cautious mood among investors amid global uncertainties.

Reliance wins US licence for Venezuelan oil as India wavers on Russia supplyReliance applied for the licence in early January as India looks to diversify its energy purchases. Direct purchase of Venezuelan oil will help Reliance replace Russian oil in a cost-effective way.

Cheque bounced? How one mistake can spiral into legal and financial troubleA bounced cheque may seem like a minor slip, but it can quickly trigger penalties, credit damage and even legal complications. What starts as a simple payment error can snowball into a serious financial setback. Are you aware of the risks?

8th Pay Commission: Government seeks public feedback; who can participateThe recommendations of the 8th Pay Commission are expected to influence future salary structures, allowances and pension benefits for central government staff.

Gold, silver prices rise slightly: Rise ahead or fall on the cards?After days of volatility, gold and silver have posted modest gains, catching the attention of investors. The small rise has reopened a familiar debate, i.e., are precious metals preparing for another climb, or is a fresh dip still possible?

entertainment.headline: Vijay Deverakonda, Rashmika Mandanna to marry on Feb 26, reception invite surfaces Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakona's wedding reception invite has been circulated in the media. The couple is getting married in February, with a reception planned in March.

Rajpal Yadav gets interim bail after depositing Rs 1.5 crore in cheque bounce case The Delhi High Court on Monday granted Bollywood actor Rajpal Yadav interim bail on the condition that he deposited Rs 1.5 crore by 3 pm in the ongoing cheque bounce case. The bail will allow him to attend his niece's wedding on February 19.

Are there dos and don'ts to meet South stars? Cinematographer Senthil Kumar answers Cinematographer KK Senthil Kumar dispels rumours about rules before meeting the South stars. He emphasises respect for technicians and promotes his upcoming film Swayambhu.

Rajkummar Rao clarifies after recent pics spark concern: Will always work hardest Rajkummar Rao clarified his changed appearance is for an upcoming biopic. He shared insights on his physical transformation.

Sobhita Dhulipala on avoiding excessive publicity: Don't want to be visible 24x7 Sobhita Dhulipala said she does not believe in aggressive PR culture and prefers to stay focused on her work rather than constant visibility.

Trisha condemns Tamil Nadu BJP chief's crass remark: Disrespect will be called out Actor Trisha Krishnan has criticised the remarks made by BJP state president Nainar Nagendran, who referenced her in a comment about actor-politician Vijay. The incident has sparked debate about the use of personal lives in political discourse as the Tamil Nadu election approaches.

Abhishek Bachchan confirms new look for Shah Rukh Khan's King. Watch Abhishek Bachchan has confirmed his involvement in Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming film King, attributing his recent hairstyle change to the role.  The film also stars Suhana Khan, Abhay Verma, and Raghav Juyal in key roles.

Mahaan 2 with Vikram and Dhruv in early stages, says Karthik Subbaraj Director Karthik Subbaraj reveals the script of Mahaan 2 is still in early development, and it will likely be 2027 or 2028 by the time the film happens. The sequel will continue the story of the popular Tamil gangster drama.

Why Raveena Tandon called Yami Gautam to apologise after watching Dhurandhar Actor Raveena Tandon has expressed her admiration for Aditya Dhar's film Dhurandhar, starring Ranveer Singh and Akshaye Khanna, which released in December 2025. Tandon was so moved by the film that she contacted actor Yami Gautam and praised her husband's hard work.

Sonu Sood prays for Rajpal Yadav's bail ahead of hearing, calls him a rare talent Sonu Sood showed public support for Rajpal Yadav as the latter faces a crucial bail hearing in the Delhi High Court today. The actor wrote a note on social media following Yadav's conviction in a Rs 9 crore cheque bounce case.

Abhishek Bachchan shares how daily experiences inspire his investment decisions Speaking at the Global Business Summit 2026, Abhishek Bachchan talked about how his investments in various brands have been inspired by his personal experiences at home.

How Telugu producer Allu Aravind fought for Tamils in 1960s anti-Hindi protests Allu Aravind, renowned Telugu film producer, shared insights on his involvement as a student leader in the 1960s anti-Hindi protests in Tamil Nadu, describing his motivations, actions during the demonstrations, and interactions with political leaders of the era.

Daisy Shah joins Shreyas Talpade in Palaash Muchhal's directorial Palash Muchhal is gearing up to direct a new thriller starring Shreyas Talpade and Daisy Shah. This project marks his professional comeback after his wedding with Smriti Mandhana was called off amid controversy.

Anushka Sharma, Virat Kohli keep it classy in white at Mumbai airport. Watch Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli were clicked at Mumbai airport with coordinated and understated looks. The two are speculated to have left for London.

Why do National Film Awards ignore casting? The Mukesh Chhabra interview | Part I Why is casting still absent from the National Film Awards? In this multi-interview series, starting with Mukesh Chhabra, India Today reflects on India's casting ecosystem and why recognition now feels overdue. As the industry evolves, we try to turn the spotlight on a category that policymakers may no longer be able to overlook.

Should Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani have a sequel? Ranbir Kapoor has a clear answer Ranbir Kapoor shared updates about his film lineup during a recent Instagram Live session. He clarified that there will be no sequel to Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani while also revealing new timelines for his upcoming films.

Viral: Harper Beckham's Valentine's Day wish for 'best big brothers' amid feud Harper Beckham shared a sweet Valentine's Day messages for her brothers, showing their close bond despite ongoing family tensions. The post has gone viral.

Rashmika, Vijay arrive separately, but leave in same car at Mumbai airport. Watch Actors Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda, who are at the centre of ongoing wedding rumours, were seen arriving in Mumbai separately but leaving together in the same car. The two are yet to share an official statement.

Eternity: Elizabeth Olsen-Miles Teller unearth enduring bonds, imperfect love David Freyne's Eternity reimagines romance by showing how the raw, resilient threads of lifelong love weave a deeper eternity than any fleeting spark.

general news.headline: Ex-Assam Congress chief Bhupen Borah withdraws resignation hours after quitting partyEarlier in the day, Bhupen Kumar Borah had sent his resignation letter to Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge, reportedly citing that he was being "ignored" by the party leadership and not given his due within the state unit.

Trisha condemns Tamil Nadu BJP chief's crass remark: Disrespect will be called outActor Trisha Krishnan has criticised the remarks made by BJP state president Nainar Nagendran, who referenced her in a comment about actor-politician Vijay. The incident has sparked debate about the use of personal lives in political discourse as the Tamil Nadu election approaches.

India's big AI moment, PM to host global tech titans at mega summit todayDay 1 will include a leadership session on leveraging AI for the future of learning and work, examining its impact on global employment and skills. Another session will explore how artificial intelligence can transform India's judicial system by improving efficiency, transparency, and accessibility.

A new East India Company rising? Rubio's speech signals US colonial aspirationAt the Munich Security Conference, US Secretary of State Marco Rubio called on the West to compete for "market share in the economies of the Global South" as part of building a "new Western century". Critics point to the coloniser tone in Rubio's speech and ask countries like India to criticise it.

Vijay Deverakonda, Rashmika Mandanna to marry on Feb 26, reception invite surfacesRashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakona's wedding reception invite has been circulated in the media. The couple is getting married in February, with a reception planned in March.

Rajpal Yadav gets interim bail after depositing Rs 1.5 crore in cheque bounce caseThe Delhi High Court on Monday granted Bollywood actor Rajpal Yadav interim bail on the condition that he deposited Rs 1.5 crore by 3 pm in the ongoing cheque bounce case. The bail will allow him to attend his niece's wedding on February 19.

Incompetent, ignorant: Akhtar tears into PCB chief after India hammers PakIND vs PAK, T20 World Cup: Shoaib Akhtar launched a scathing attack on PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi and senior players after Pakistan's 61-run loss to India, calling incompetent leadership "the biggest crime in the world."

3rd time lucky? Madhya Pradesh IAS officer marries again, new bride also bureaucratMadhya Pradesh cadre IAS officer Avi Prasad's earlier marriages were to IAS officers Riju Bafna, currently posted as Collector of Shajapur, and Misha Singh, now Collector of Ratlam.

Deadly Bhubaneswar rooftop blast caught on camera, 2 die during treatmentInvestigators believe the explosion occurred while explosive materials were being handled on the rooftop. Gunpowder was recovered from the site, strengthening suspicions that crude bombs were being assembled there.

Why staying too long in one company may be costing employeesCompanies across India are paying new hires significantly higher salaries than existing employees. This growing pay gap challenges traditional loyalty and pushes professionals to reconsider their career strategies.

In 2026 India, is Mysore silk saree the Birkin people queue up for at 4 am?Handcrafted ByOur Editors If you're someone who keeps track of viral videos, you would, by no means, have missed the clip of women queuing outside a store in Bengaluru at 4 am for a Mysore silk saree. But what's causing the demand? Has it gained a Birkin-like status among Indians?

Suryakumar Yadav asked teammates not to sledge Pakistan, BCCI releases BTS videoIndia captain Suryakumar Yadav instructed his team to avoid sledging during their T20 World Cup clash with Pakistan. The disciplined approach helped India secure a commanding 61-run victory and qualify for the Super 8 stage.

Abandoned by mum: Monkey winning hearts online hides wounds of traumaAbandoned by his mother at birth, and after being cared for by people during early development, Punch was moved to a zoo to live with other macaques. But the transition was not easy.

Mohanlal, Kamal Haasan salute parents of Aalin, Kerala's youngest organ donorAalin's parents decided to donate her organs -- including her liver, kidneys, heart valve and corneas -- which were successfully transplanted, helping save the lives of five children across multiple hospitals.

Bondi Beach shooter Naveed Akram appears in court, says just two wordsNaveed Akram, the surviving Bondi Beach terrorist, appeared before a court for the first time. Naveed and his father Sajid Akram, who had decades ago migrated from Hyderabad, shot dead 15 people on December 14, which was one of Australia's deadliest terror attacks. In court, Naveed said just two words.

Not a political arena: Supreme Court raps petitioner over Himanta Sarma gun videoThe Supreme Court strongly criticised a petitioner for directly approaching it instead of the High Court over allegations against Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma. The bench highlighted concerns over courts being used as political battlegrounds ahead of elections and urged respect for constitutional procedures.

Man paid Rs 50,000 a year premium, insurance claim denied when mother fell illThe man said he had been paying around Rs 50,000 every year for his mother's policy and when she needed treatment, he went to the Lucknow office of Star Health and Allied Insurance, where he alleged he was made to wait for hours. His claim was denied.

Dear CBSE 2026 candidate: Stop. Don't make these mistakes tonightStudents across India gear up for CBSE Board Exams 2026 with last-minute revisions. Experts warn against common mistakes the night before that can impact performance and confidence.

Death of a rivalry: Has India vs Pakistan lost its magic due to overexposure?T20 World Cup: Cricket's greatest rivalry has become its most overplayed fixture. The guaranteed group-stage meetings are killing the magic, stifling emerging teams, and turning spectacle into monotony.

Why the Rafale buy mattersThe IAF needs the 114 jets to bolster its falling squadron numbers— it has just 29 fighter squadrons against a sanctioned strength of 42, even as adversaries Pakistan and China are bolstering their air forces.

Marriage at 29, shared salaries and second chances mark India's matrimony resetA lot has changed between 2016 and 2025 in India's matchmaking landscape. A new report by matrimonial platform Jeevansathi highlights these major shifts.

North Korea's next ruler? Showdown between Kim Jong un's daughter vs auntSouth Korean intelligence suggests Kim Jong-un may be grooming his daughter Kim Ju-ae as successor. Experts warn this could spark a family power struggle, with Kim Yo-jong also eyeing the top post.

A new low: When Pakistan lost to India as early as toss. Over and out.T20 World Cup, IND vs PAK: Pakistan had little go their way after choosing to bowl first in Colombo, where teams batting second have struggled throughout the tournament. Their decision backfired as Pakistan slumped to a 61-run defeat on Sunday.

Why do National Film Awards ignore casting? The Mukesh Chhabra interview | Part IWhy is casting still absent from the National Film Awards? In this multi-interview series, starting with Mukesh Chhabra, India Today reflects on India's casting ecosystem and why recognition now feels overdue. As the industry evolves, we try to turn the spotlight on a category that policymakers may no longer be able to overlook.

sports.headline: Abhishek Sharma will bounce back: Harbhajan backs batter after duck vs PAK T20 World Cup: Harbhajan Singh backed Abhishek Sharma to bounce back after two ducks in the T20 World Cup, including a four-ball duck vs Pakistan. The former spinner said Abhishek will deliver when India need him most.

All-round Azmat helps Afghanistan beat UAE, remain in Super 8s race T20 World Cup: Azmatullah Omarzai's all-round brilliance has powered Afghanistan to a five-wicket win over UAE in New Delhi to remain in the race to reach the Super 8 stage of the T20 World Cup 2026.

New Zealand women start new era as Amelia Kerr appointed as all-format captain The New Zealand women's team will usher in a new era as Amelia Kerr has been appointed as the new all-format captain of the side on Monday, February 16. Kerr takes over from Sophie Devine as the new skipper of the White Ferns.

Suryakumar Yadav asked teammates not to sledge Pakistan, BCCI releases BTS video India captain Suryakumar Yadav instructed his team to avoid sledging during their T20 World Cup clash with Pakistan. The disciplined approach helped India secure a commanding 61-run victory and qualify for the Super 8 stage.

Death of a rivalry: Has India vs Pakistan lost its magic due to overexposure? T20 World Cup: Cricket's greatest rivalry has become its most overplayed fixture. The guaranteed group-stage meetings are killing the magic, stifling emerging teams, and turning spectacle into monotony.

Devdutt Padikkal puts selectors on alert with maiden double ton vs Uttarakhand Devdutt Padikkal put India selectors on alert with his maiden first-class double century in the Ranji Trophy semi-final against Uttarakhand. The Karnataka captain's 232-run knock strengthened his case for a Test recall.

Steve Smith replaces Josh Hazlewood in Australia squad ahead of Sri Lanka clash Steve Smith has been named as a replacement for injured Josh Hazlewood in the Australia squad for the T20 World Cup 2026. His inclusion will strengthen Australia's batting as they prepare to face Sri Lanka in a crucial fixture.

Unable to digest defeat, Mohsin Naqvi leaves stadium midway through chase As Pakistan's middle-order collapsed against India in Colombo, Mohsin Naqvi decided to leave the stadium mid-way through the chase. India dominated Pakistan to secure a thumping 61-run win on Sunday, February 15.

Ex-Pakistan spinner mocks IND vs PAK Colombo rout: Boycott was better T20 World Cup: Ex-Pakistan spinner Danish Kaneria mocked Pakistan's humiliating 61-run loss to India in Colombo. Kaneria suggested a boycott would have been less embarrassing as Pakistan's Super 8 hopes now hang by a thread.

AFG vs UAE Highlights: Afghanistan beat UAE by 5 wickets to stay in Super 8s race Afghanistan (AFG) vs UAE (UAE), T20 World Cup Highlights: Afghanistan have kept their Super 8s dreams alive by beating UAE by 5 wickets in what turned out to be a thriller in New Delhi. Azmatullah Omarzai's all-round brilliance has given Afghanistan a glimmer of hope.

Like Kohli in Melbourne, Ishan Kishan finds cricket's loneliest place in ColomboT20 World Cup 2026: In Colombo against Pakistan, Ishan Kishan found cricket's loneliest place, the same space Virat Kohli once inhabited in Melbourne, but reached it through dominance rather than endurance.

India's C team will thrash Pakistan: Srikkanth calls for end of greatest rivalry hypeT20 World Cup: After Pakistan's surrender to India during the T20 World Cup 2026, Kris Srikkanth said that the Indian C team is enough to beat the arch-rivals. Srikkanth heavily criticised the Pakistan batting after the heavy defeat in Colombo.

A new low: When Pakistan lost to India as early as toss. Over and out.T20 World Cup, IND vs PAK: Pakistan had little go their way after choosing to bowl first in Colombo, where teams batting second have struggled throughout the tournament. Their decision backfired as Pakistan slumped to a 61-run defeat on Sunday.

Has Babar Azam ever played a Kohli-esque knock? Irfan Pathan slams PAK batterT20 World Cup: Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan has slammed Babar Azam after another flopshow against India, asking if he has ever played a knock like Virat Kohli in a pressure game. Babar was dismissed for five runs in Colombo.

Drop Babar, Shaheen, Shadab: Afridi goes on all-out rant after IND vs PAK lossT20 World Cup: Shahid Afridi has urged Pakistan to bench Babar Azam, Shaheen Afridi and Shadab Khan after another heavy loss to India in Colombo. He wants youngsters trusted for the remaining T20 World Cup matches.

Abhishek Sharma gets key advice from Shastri on form revival after PAK failureT20 World Cup: Abhishek Sharma was given key advice on how to turn his form around as his recent slump in form continued during the India vs Pakistan game on Sunday, February 15. Abhishek was dismissed for a duck during the match in Colombo.

Watch: Rohit Sharma hugs Pakistan legend Wasim Akram in ColomboT20 World Cup: Former India captain Rohit Sharma shared a warm hug with Pakistan legend Wasim Akram during the pre-match ceremony in Colombo. The moment went viral ahead of India's dominant 61-run win over Pakistan.

Incompetent, ignorant: Akhtar tears into PCB chief after India hammers PakIND vs PAK, T20 World Cup: Shoaib Akhtar launched a scathing attack on PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi and senior players after Pakistan's 61-run loss to India, calling incompetent leadership "the biggest crime in the world."

Do Pakistan deserve arch-rivals tag? Axar rubs salt into wounds after Colombo winT20 World Cup, India vs Pakistan: Star Indian all-rounder Axar Patel added to Pakistan's misery after the comprehensive 61-run win over the Salman Ali Agha-led side, playing down the hype around the rivalry between the two teams.

Matchday Preview: Struggling Australia look to breathe life into their campaignT20 World Cup: Day 10 of the tournament features crucial clashes in Delhi, Kolkata and Pallekele as Afghanistan face UAE, England meet Italy and Australia take on Sri Lanka in matches that could shape the Super 8 race.

IND vs PAK: Axar Patel focused on being a team man, not stressed about changing rolesHere is the full transcript of India all-rounder Axar Patel's press conference after their 61-run loss to India in the Group A clash in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup in Colombo.

Pakistan no match for India in skill and temperament: Sunil GavaskarT20 World Cup 2026: Speaking to India Today after India's 61-run victory in Colombo, legendary Sunil Gavaskar highlighted the gulf in skill and temperament between the two sides. He also heaped praise on Ishan Kishan for his superb 77 off 40 balls, noting that the innings effectively took the game away from Pakistan on Sunday.

Fearless Ishan Kishan took the game away from Pakistan: Pak coach Mike HessonIndia vs Pakistan, ICC T20 World Cup: Pakistan head coach Mike Hesson said it was Ishan Kishan's counter-attacking knock, rather than the top-order collapse, that proved to be the difference between the two sides in Pakistan's 61-run defeat to India in Colombo.

Heartbroken Pakistan fan smashes TV after humbling loss to India in ColomboT20 World Cup, IND vs PAK: A heartbroken Pakistan supporter was filmed smashing his television set following the team's crushing 61-run defeat to India in Colombo. He was just one of millions left reeling after Sunday's humbling at the hands of their arch-rivals.

Time's up for Babar, Shaheen: Ex-captain slams Pakistan stars after India lossFormer Pakistan captain Mohammad Yousuf has launched a scathing attack on the team's senior core after Pakistan's crushing 61-run defeat to India in the ICC T20 World Cup 2026 in Colombo, declaring that it is "time's up" for Babar Azam, Shaheen Shah Afridi and Shadab Khan.

This is for India: Surya after crushing Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2026IND vs PAK, T20 World Cup: Suryakumar Yadav dedicated their 61-run win over Pakistan to his nation, India. Ishan Kishan's 77 and Jasprit Bumrah's brilliance powered India to the Super Eight stage in Colombo on Sunday.

Why was Usman Tariq held back against India? Coach clarifies surprise moveT20 World Cup, IND vs PAK: Pakistan coach Mike Hesson explained why Usman Tariq was held back during the match against India. On Sunday, Pakistan suffered a 61-run defeat, with Tariq returning figures of 4-0-24-1.

Watch: Irfan Pathan dances to 'Afghan Jalebi' to troll Pakistan after India's winFormer India all-rounder Irfan Pathan trolled Pakistan by sharing a video of himself dancing to the popular track 'Afghan Jalebi' after India's comprehensive 61-run win in the Group A clash in Colombo.

Pakistan in danger of early T20 World Cup exit. Can it really happen?T20 World Cup, IND vs PAK: Salman Agha's Pakistan are in danger of an early exit from the tournament following their 61-run defeat to Suryakumar Yadav's India on Sunday at the R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo.

No surprise: India steamroll predictably poor Pakistan to march into Super 8sIND vs PAK, T20 World Cup 2026: India hammered a predictably poor Pakistan by 61 runs to storm into the Super 8s stage. Handing Pakistan their biggest defeat in T20i head-to-head, India aced the battle of spin in Colombo on Sunday, February 15.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
